res.content_title: The Chopping Block: Market Meltdown, CZ vs. Star Feud, and Tarun's Epstein Files Cameo
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed in relation to Jeffrey Epstein's investment in the company in 2014 at a $400 million valuation. The discussion covered how this deal was arranged by Brock Pierce and Blockchain Capital, with Epstein describing it as a 'platinum plated deal.'

res.content_title: Palmer Luckey on Hardware, Building, and the Next Frontiers of Innovation
res.tag_context: Palmer Luckey was nearly Coinbase's first merchant customer in 2012, working with Brian Armstrong to integrate Bitcoin payments for Oculus before lawyers intervened. This illustrates his early involvement in cryptocurrency.

res.content_title: BITGO IPO, HIP-3, KNTQ | Livestream
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed as BitGo's main competitor in the custody space, particularly noting their dominance in ETF custody services with 80% market share. They were also mentioned for their Prime services and competitive advantages.

res.content_title: Why the Future of Finance Runs in Software | Jeremy Allaire
res.tag_context: Coinbase is discussed extensively as a key partner and distributor of USDC, with detailed explanation of how transactions work between Circle and Coinbase. The conversation also covers Coinbase's regulatory challenges with the SEC.

res.content_title: The Future of Everything: What CEOs of Circle, CrowdStrike & More See Coming in 2026
res.series_name: All-In with Chamath, Jason, Sacks & Friedberg
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed as a major cryptocurrency exchange and partner of Circle, with references to CEO Brian Armstrong's use of AI for organizational insights and the company's role in the crypto ecosystem.

res.content_title: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong Breaks Down the Three Biggest Trends in Crypto + More from Davos!
res.series_name: All-In with Chamath, Jason, Sacks & Friedberg
res.tag_context: Coinbase was the primary focus of the first interview, with CEO Brian Armstrong discussing the company's partnerships with major banks, regulatory challenges, stablecoin business, and strategic direction in detail.

res.content_title: ROLLUP: Trump Eyes Greenland | Davos Goes Crypto | NYSE Goes Onchain | Quantum Spooks Bitcoin | Farcaster + Lens Acquired
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed in multiple contexts: Brian Armstrong's appearance at Davos defending Bitcoin against central bankers, their opposition to the Clarity Act over stablecoin yield provisions, and their announcement of an independent advisory board on quantum computing threats to crypto.

res.content_title: The Chopping Block: Crypto Clarity Act Drama + Stablecoin Yield Wars + Developer Liability Fights
res.tag_context: Coinbase was a major focus as they withdrew support for the Clarity Act just before markup, with CEO Brian Armstrong citing concerns about tokenized equities bans, DeFi prohibitions, and stablecoin reward restrictions. Their opposition became a central point of controversy in the legislative process.

res.content_title: Why Bitcoin Isn't Acting as Digital Gold & International Stocks Are Winning - Bits + Bips
res.tag_context: Coinbase was extensively discussed for withdrawing support from the market structure bill, calling it 'unworkable.' The discussion covered their policy positions, their global head of research David Dong's participation, and their role in crypto regulation negotiations.

res.content_title: The Duopolies of 2026: Ethereum & Solana, Coinbase & Robinhood, Polymarket & Kalshi | Ryan, David & Arnav Pagidyala
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed as part of the centralized exchange duopoly with Robinhood, including analysis of their strategic direction, creator coin initiatives, and integration with Morpho for lending services.

res.content_title: Aerodrome’s Big Upgrade | Alexander Cutler
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed extensively as a key integration partner for Arrow, with mentions of Coinbase Ventures as a potential token holder and the Base app integration for routing trades. Their verification systems and business relationship with Arrow were highlighted.

res.content_title: Why 2026 Is 'Too Chaotic' to Make Crypto Predictions
res.tag_context: Coinbase is mentioned multiple times in relation to Base L2, their perps exchange, prediction market partnerships with Kalshi, and various legal challenges around sports betting regulations.

res.content_title: The Crypto Market Structure Has Changed and Rising Tides May No Longer Lift All Boats
res.tag_context: Coinbase was extensively discussed as one of the main contenders in the super app thesis, with detailed analysis of their dual strategy involving traditional exchange services and their social media/Base app ecosystem including Farcaster and Zora.

res.content_title: The Chopping Block: Aave Civil War + Flow Hack + Coinbase Super-App - Ep. 993
res.tag_context: Coinbase received significant discussion regarding their 'System Update' announcement, where they're expanding into stocks, ETFs, prediction markets, and other financial services. The hosts analyzed their strategy of becoming an 'everything app' and compared it to Robinhood's approach.

res.content_title: Bits + Bips: 2026 Crypto Predictions: BTC & ETH Hit Record Highs, Stablecoins Go Big
res.tag_context: Coinbase was extensively discussed through guest John d'Agostino's role there, their recent $400 million security issue, their stablecoin branding kit announcement, and their potential role in derivatives trading and M&A activity. The company was central to multiple discussion threads about crypto infrastructure and regulation.

res.content_title: Landmark Regulation, ICOs, Downtober & Privacy: 2025 Crypto Year in Review (Part 2) - Ep. 991
res.tag_context: Coinbase was extensively discussed regarding their acquisition of Echo for $400 million, their customer service problems, and how Kobe is now helping fix their support issues. The hosts shared personal experiences with Coinbase's poor customer service and account recovery problems.

res.content_title: Investing Trends for 2026: DeFi, Tokenization, Capital Formation, Speculation & AI | Ben Lakoff & Arnav from Bankless Ventures
res.tag_context: Coinbase is discussed as an example of the 'DeFi mullet' concept, integrating Morpho lending products to offer users competitive APY rates. Their integration drove Morpho's TVL from $700 million to $3.3 billion, demonstrating how centralized platforms can drive DeFi adoption.

res.content_title: 12 Big Crypto Predictions for 2026 | Ryan & David
res.tag_context: Coinbase was extensively referenced as both a prediction source and for their institutional crypto services. The hosts discussed their predictions about tokenization, DATs evolution, and their integration with various DeFi protocols.

res.content_title: Bits + Bips: Will Crypto Rise on Liquidity or Will 2026 See Another Washout? - Ep. 988
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed multiple times regarding their super app strategy, competitive positioning against Robinhood, their structural advantages in KYC/compliance, and their recent announcements about stablecoin-as-a-service and prediction market acquisitions.

res.content_title: DAT Stocks Are on Sale. Are They a Buy? Plus, Why Crypto Is Dead - Ep.945
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed multiple times as an example of a company positioning itself well for mainstream crypto adoption, including recent announcements about adding stock trading and prediction markets to become an 'everything app.'

res.content_title: 10 Crypto Predictions for 2026: $1M BTC, Wall Street Onchain & ETF Takeover | Matt Hougan & Ryan Rasmussen from Bitwise
res.tag_context: Coinbase is discussed as a major crypto equity example, being part of the S&P 500, and as a company that operates across the entire crypto ecosystem. It's mentioned as an example of how crypto equities outperform traditional tech stocks and as a proxy investment for those wanting crypto exposure.

res.content_title: Bits + Bips: Crypto Investing Is About Managing Risk, Not Chasing Upside - Ep. 978
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed both as an exchange subject to new tax reporting requirements and as having an exclusive partnership with Steakhouse Financial for USDC lending vaults worth $400 million.

res.content_title: Crypto's Killer App?
res.tag_context: Coinbase is discussed as Circle's early partner in launching USDC and as Zach's former employer. The conversation covers the experimental nature of USDC's early development and Coinbase's role in the ecosystem.

res.content_title: The Return of the ICO | Ryan & David
res.tag_context: Coinbase was highlighted for acquiring Echo platform and conducting the Monad ICO directly through their platform, representing a major regulatory milestone. The hosts noted this as significant because Coinbase has historically been cautious about securities law compliance.

res.content_title: Inside Gary Gensler’s SEC: A Conversation with Former Crypto Policy Advisor Corey Frayer
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed as a major crypto exchange that the SEC engaged with regarding registration and compliance, and was mentioned in the context of enforcement actions and the broader debate over crypto regulation.

res.content_title: Bits + Bips:  How Stocks May Decouple From Bitcoin—and Why TradFi Should Love a HYPE DAT - Ep. 972
res.tag_context: Extensively discussed as a major crypto exchange that Owen Lau covers as an analyst. The conversation explored Coinbase's diversification strategy, revenue streams, potential prediction market offerings, and correlation with Bitcoin prices.

res.content_title: ROLLUP: Buy Signal? | Fusaka Launch | Polymarket Mainstream | Trump’s Fed Chair | SEC Crypto Shift
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed in relation to CEO Brian Armstrong's relationship with Larry Fink, Kevin Hassett's disclosed stake in the company, and potential white-labeling services for other brokerages. The company was positioned as crypto-friendly within the traditional finance ecosystem.

res.content_title: The Chopping Block: Token Launch Hype, L1 Wars & Prediction Market Breakouts - Ep. 969
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed as the platform that hosted Monad's token sale, which was described as the first ever token sale on Coinbase. The discussion highlighted how this provided broad distribution with over 85,000 KYC'd participants.

res.content_title: DEX in the City: Class Actions in Crypto Are on the Rise. Are They More Dangerous Than SEC Enforcement?- Ep. 968
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed as an example of a crypto company facing derivative lawsuits from shareholders alleging insider trading by executives. The hosts noted that as a large public crypto company, Coinbase gets sued frequently and has talented legal representation.

res.content_title: The 2025 Crypto Trends Report | Alana Levin
res.tag_context: Coinbase is discussed multiple times as a major cryptocurrency exchange, stablecoin distributor, and innovator in integrating DEX functionality. Their role in productizing DeFi services and potential stablecoin initiatives is analyzed.

res.content_title: The Holy Grail of Crypto Privacy: Encrypted Ethereum, FHE & Living Forever | Rand Hindi, Zama Co-Founder
res.tag_context: Coinbase is mentioned multiple times in various contexts including crypto-backed loans, MPC wallet implementations, and as an example of exchanges that could integrate confidential tokens. The discussion includes how Coinbase uses MPC technology and could serve as an on/off ramp for private transactions.

res.content_title: Uneasy Money: Monad Soars After Launch. Was Its Slow ICO an Advantage in the End? - Ep. 963
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed as the platform that hosted Monad's ICO through their new platform, with detailed analysis of their allocation strategy and comparison to their previous launches like Mega Eth.

res.content_title: DEX in the City: Insider Trading and Crypto: What the Law Actually Says - Ep. 962
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed as the central company in the Wahi insider trading case, where an employee used knowledge of upcoming token listings to trade ahead of announcements. The case served as a key example of traditional insider trading theory applied to crypto.

res.content_title: Bits + Bips: Why the Markets Now Have a Bullish Setup - Ep. 960
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed in multiple contexts including the Monad ICO launch on their platform, their stock being potentially rejected as collateral by banks, and their role in enabling US retail access to token launches in a compliant manner.

res.content_title: Do We Need Another L1? - Inside Monad’s Parallel EVM with Co-Founder Keone Hon
res.tag_context: Coinbase is featured prominently in discussion of Monad's token sale, being the first project on Coinbase's new token sales platform. The conversation explores how this partnership enables broader token distribution and represents a shift in the regulatory environment.

res.content_title: Uneasy Money: Hyperliquid's Dilemma After 10/10: Protect Itself or Its Users? - Ep. 954
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed as launching a new ICO platform for projects like Monad, separate from their acquisition of Sonar. The hosts viewed Coinbase's involvement as legitimizing the ICO space and providing regulatory cover for participants.

res.content_title: DEX in the City: Are Prediction Markets Gambling, and Who Should Regulate Them? - Ep. 952
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed as the platform for the Monad token sale, with analysis of how using a centralized exchange may have affected participation and added friction through KYC requirements.

res.content_title: Pricing the Future (with Kalshi CEO)
res.tag_context: Coinbase is discussed as a positive example of a regulated crypto company that Kalshi aspires to emulate, contrasted with FTX's unregulated approach and eventual failure.

res.content_title: State of The Market, DAT Bubble Burst & Hyperliquid
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed in relation to Base chain's growth potential and their ability to leverage their exchange platform to drive ecosystem adoption. The hosts compared their strategy to Binance's approach with BNB Chain and analyzed Base's competitive positioning.

res.content_title: The Chopping Block: Tokenomics Reset — ICOs Rise, UNI Turns On Fees, MEV Goes to Court - Ep. 949
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed as facilitating Monad's ICO, marking their first ICO product launch. The hosts compared Coinbase's ICO timeout mechanism to Robinhood's IPO flipping penalties for users who quickly sell their allocations.

res.content_title: How the x402 Standard Is Enabling AI Agents to Pay Each Other - Ep. 948
res.tag_context: Coinbase was the primary focus as Eric Reppel works there as head of engineering for the developer platform and authored the x402 standard. The discussion extensively covered Coinbase's role in developing x402, their developer platform (CDP), and their business initiatives around stablecoin payments.

res.content_title: ROLLUP: Market Uncertainty | Trump’s Bullish Plan? | Coinbase ICOs Return | Uniswap Fee Switch On | JPM Base Coin | Crypto Privacy Season?
res.tag_context: Coinbase was a major focus as they launched a new token sales platform (ICO platform) with Monad as the first token sale. The discussion covered how this represents a shift in regulatory confidence and Coinbase's strategy to integrate more vertically in the token lifecycle.

res.content_title: ROLLUP: Bull Market Over? | BTC 50W Breakdown | Balancer Hack | Stream Finance Collapse | Brian Armstrong’s Prediction Market Drama
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed in relation to CEO Brian Armstrong's controversial manipulation of prediction markets during an earnings call, where he intentionally said specific words to influence betting outcomes on Polymarket and Kalshi.

res.content_title: Will Perps Eat All of Finance? Ex-FTX.US CEO Brett Harrison Bets Yes  - Ep. 940
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed as a major exchange positioning itself as an 'everything exchange' and mentioned as a multiple-time investor in Architect. Harrison sees potential for distributing Architect's products through Coinbase's platform.

res.content_title: x402: The Key to Internet Money, Micropayments & The AI Agent Economy | Sam Ragsdale
res.tag_context: Coinbase launched the X402 protocol in May and created the original specification. The company is credited with taking the HTTP 402 status code 'off the shelf' and building a crypto payments standard around it.

res.content_title: The Chopping Block: When Wall Street Meets DeFi — How Equity Perps and RWAs Redefine Leverage On-Chain  - Ep. 937
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed for their $375 million acquisition of Echo, a crowd sale platform, and their strategy to go more full-stack in the token lifecycle. The acquisition was analyzed as part of the broader M&A trends in crypto.

res.content_title: ROLLUP: Markets Spooked? | MegaETH & Monad Mania | New CFTC Chair | Base & Polymarket Tokens? | Circle Arc Backlash
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed in relation to a hypothetical Base token that JP Morgan valued at $34 billion, and their partnership with Citi for digital asset payment solutions. The hosts analyzed the potential impact on Coinbase's stock price.

res.content_title: Arthur Hayes and Adam Schlegel on Why Private Equity Is Crypto's Next Big Wave - Ep. 933
res.tag_context: Coinbase is frequently mentioned as a major exchange and potential acquirer of crypto companies. The hosts discuss Coinbase's acquisition of Echo and its strategy to compete with other exchanges through new product offerings.

res.content_title: Why Pro Athletes Are Betting on Bitcoin, Crypto & Prediction Markets | Tristan Thompson & Paul Grewal
res.tag_context: Coinbase was the primary focus throughout the episode, with Paul Grewal serving as Chief Legal Officer. The discussion extensively covered Coinbase's regulatory battles, product offerings, staking services, and political advocacy efforts in Washington D.C.

res.content_title: Macro Takes, Echo Deals, and the MEGA Token | Livestream
res.tag_context: Coinbase was discussed in relation to its acquisition of Echo, with concerns raised about potential negative impacts on the platform's quality and curation. Speakers expressed worry about Coinbase's historical issues with KYC data.
